definitions.definition: To strongly and solemnly refuse to own or acknowledge ; to deny responsibility for, approbation of, and the like.
examples: He was charged with embezzlement, but he disavows the crime.

definitions.definition: To deny ; to show the contrary of; to deny legitimacy or achievement of any kind.
examples: Because of her dissatisfaction, she now disavows the merits of fascism.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To strongly and solemnly refuse to own or acknowledge ; to deny responsibility for, approbation of, and the like.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To deny ; to show the contrary of; to deny legitimacy or achievement of any kind.
